text:
We held an event at Jie Jie by Jetwing on October 26 and, unfortunately, were disappointed by the experience, especially considering the superb service we had received in previous years. Although we don‚Äôt expect five-star standards, our past events at Jie Jie by Jetwing since 2018 had been handled excellently. However, with the recent management change, the service quality and overall experience seem to have noticeably declined.

Firstly, while Mr. Eric and Champika made commendable efforts, certain issues impacted our event.

The handling of the event‚Äôs end time by Mr. Wasantha felt unprofessional‚Äîthough we had agreed on a midnight end, he began pressuring us to stop the band as early as 11:15 p.m. This created unnecessary stress and disruption.

Additionally, despite providing 10 kg of dry bites, 15 kg of guava, and 160 green apples, only a few plates were served in the Grand Ballroom, making us question if our items were served as agreed. Furthermore, staff often cleared plates and glasses without checking if they were still in use, disrupting our guests‚Äô experience.

The driver meal was substandard, not in line with what we'd expect from a star-class hotel. Some staff members even spoke rudely to our team, including senior managers, and the overall attitude felt rushed, as if the staff were eager for the event to end. Due to the rain, we wanted to use the indoor entrance to the ballroom, but staff discouraged this, causing inconvenience.

We were also charged unexpectedly an additional Rs. 25,000 for electricity, which we had assumed was included in our package.

An extra 24 bottles of soft drinks were billed without our authorization, which led to unapproved additional costs.

There was a significant water leak in the ballroom due to heavy rain, We intended to block one door of the Grand Ball Room, but the lock was broken, the key card for one of our rooms failed, and our team had to wait nearly an hour for access. The maintenance team eventually opened the door manually, attributing the issue to a dead lock battery and an unpleasant odor in the hall, all of which affected the ambiance of our event.

Overall, despite some staff efforts, our experience didn‚Äôt meet expectations.
title: Disappointing Experience at Jie Jie by Jetwing

text:
I booked a double room and a triple room for 5 people and checked in around 6pm; the initial service was excellent, as provided by 'Sithmini' from the front desk, who greeted us warmly and assigned us a room within 10 minutes; however, the room was terrible; the AC was not working, and there was no signal coverage throughout the hotel, which was fine except for the AC!!!!!

We informed the front desk, and yes, they changed our room to the next door, but the AC was still the same; we just ignored it for the time being and ordered food from the hotel restaurant, which was a Chicken Fried Rice Rs.1800 with cardboard papadam and dry rice; we also ordered a boneless chicken, but the restaurant call operator asked what we meant by boneless. Wtf, the hotel restaurant doesn't know what boneless is, so we said, "Yako, it's Katu nathi chicken," and he was like, "Ahh, okay, okay."

Still we bared everything and didn't even complain about those but when we check-out and waiting for the bill to be processed all of a sudden a hotel staff comes and says that a 'Body Lotion' is missing from the room, I was like okay so what? the person said that like I have a stolen a TV or a iron from the room, the person humiliated me Infront of my friends and other people, I have stayed in countless hotels all over Sri Lanka and I have used all the equipment's and products the hotel provides which is complimentary and which can be taken home but this hotel doesn't even let a customer who paid around 60-70k per night to take a ' Small Body Lotion' which I used during the stay, I was really annoyed and dissatisfied with the overall service the hotel gave us, idk what has happened to the Jetwing Hotel Chain.

Even the final bill was messed up; I paid the room bill when I checked in, and the final bill was only the bar and restaurant bill, but the person charged me again for the rooms and gave me a receipt for my card; again, they reimbursed the amount to my card, and I waited for more than 15 minutes, which made me think I would never come to Jetwing again or recommend anyone, not even an enemy; I hope Jetwing management looks into this.

text:
I was at Blue Water Hotel Spa - Oct 4- 6- 2024 , with friends .
 The Event was to Celebrate the Diamond Anniversary of Class of 64- University of Ceylon -- ie how it was named back then in 1964.
 Most of us now 80 + yrs arrived at Blue Water Hotel from all over the globe -

  The location was picked due to its proximity to Colombo,  well designed ( Bevis Bawa Design ) smaller hotel, with rooms at ground and level 2 mostly, spaces areas for socialization with a ocean breeze on the areas, nice Grand Ball Room for the Saturday Night Celebration ,  Organization of the  Group Photo , 
 Spaceous out side verendha area of the  Dining area, again great spot for small groups for socialization .
 Lovely Ocean front , great beach walks , beautiful garden  and pool well cared for, many parrots singing for us at twilight as they come to roost on the  many lighted coconut trees , looking like Singing  Christmas Lights !

 Gracious Thanks to Mr Shannon De Zilva of Blue Water Hotel -  Head  office in Colombo, with out whose  extremely patient and tolerant help over the past 10 months of planning, this event would never have got off the ground  !
 Co -ordinating such an event , with members, who are 80 + yrs , now  scattered around the globe was no easy task, and Mr De Zilva stepped up to the plate and helped us out, ironing out many creases along the way .
 Thank You Mr De Zilva and his Head Office Team .  

 The  Front Desk  Hotel Staff -- extremely gracious and again , very tolerant  at the  time we all descended upon them almost at the same time !

 Special mention to -  Ishani( Guest Relations )  Kushani,  Shamali,  Shakila ( Operator ) .
 Shakila -- my Special Thanks to you, for the help you gave me,  ( Deepthie Vyjanthimala !! ) making  up the Araliya Mal Mala for the Saturday night concert !

text: Absolute tropic heaven after being transferred from another hotel where we had a bad experience. The rooms were very spacious, had bathrobes, iron with board, tea station, fresh filtered water everyday, smart tv and comfortable beds. The only con is the window connecting from the room into the bathroom. The breakfast and dinner buffet never disappointed. Staff provide filtered water at the restaurants. Unfortunately, it was off season so the ocean was not safe to swim in. Still beautiful to watch though. Saw a herd of cows running along the beach which was an absolute delight to watch. You see over 100 green parrots arriving in the evening and sitting in the palm trees near the beach. I also recommend the hotel spa. I had lots of aches and pains from the trip and long flights. I felt like a new person after a Balinese massage. It was a very unique hotel and one of the best I have ever stayed at.

There‚Äôs a couple of little shops across the railway line which are worth a visit. Breakfast and dinner were served in the. Open air restaurant and we always found something tasty to eat. Thanks to Tharindu and Harikesh for their great service and attention to detail. We had a minor blip in our bill on departure so I recommend you get a copy on the night before departure so u can check for any discrepancies rather than at the last minute when your taxi is waiting.

text:
We had the most amazing week at Serene Pavilions, everything was just perfect.  When you first arrive you are instantly welcomed in to the relaxing surrounds of the reception area, which is beautiful.  After a delicious welcome drink you are shown to your own Pavilion, which is immaculate and has everything you could ever need.  These "houses" are very spacious and have lots of little touches and extras you'd expect from a boutique hotel - Serene Pavilions will not disappoint.  We'd also add, the beds and bedding are pure luxury and a good nights sleep is assured.  

You are then introduced to your own butler, who will look after you during your stay; providing you meals and drinks as requested (costs depending on the board you have chosen).
We arrived at night so didn't instantly see the gardens and swimming pool these are beautiful and we enjoyed our time simply wandering around enjoying them and the wildlife they attract.   At the bottom of the grounds is a small fence which leads directly on to the beach.

Finally, what makes Serene Pavilions extra special is the staff, everyone is so friendly and will do anything to make your stay unforgettable.  The team are now more like friends and we can't wait to visit them again and spend more time exploring this wonderful country.
title: An amazing place with special people

**Mixed Feelings at Taprobana by Asia Leisure**

Our recent visit to Taprobana by Asia Leisure left us with mixed feelings. We booked two rooms for a family gathering, including a birthday celebration for our kids and accommodation for our mother-in-law. While there were some positives, overall, the experience fell short of our expectations.

Firstly, the food at Taprobana was a highlight. We enjoyed well-prepared dishes that satisfied our taste buds, albeit the spread could have been more extensive to cater adequately for everyone.

On the downside, the location seemed somewhat neglected. Maintenance issues were noticeable, which detracted from the overall ambiance. Additionally, our rooms were not as clean as we had hoped, which was disappointing given the reputation of the establishment.

The weather didn't cooperate either, as it was a rainy day during our stay. This limited our outdoor activities and impacted our ability to fully enjoy the surroundings.

One positive aspect was the pool, which provided a refreshing escape despite the weather. It was well-maintained and offered a pleasant experience for both children and adults.

In summary, while Taprobana by Asia Leisure has its merits, such as good food and a decent pool, the overall experience was marred by issues with cleanliness, maintenance, and the weather conditions. For a special occasion like a birthday celebration, we expected a higher level of satisfaction.
